camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.ind.name: camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.index
camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.ind.description: An index for the google calendar endpoint

camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.cal.name: camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.calendarId
camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.cal.description: The calendar ID to be used as events source

camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.cli.name: camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.clientId
camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.cli.description: Client ID of the calendar application

camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.cli.name: camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.clientSecret
camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.cli.description: Client Secret of the calendar application

camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.acc.name: camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.accessToken
camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.acc.description: OAuth 2 access token for google calendar application. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.ref.name: camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.refreshToken
camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.ref.description: OAuth 2 refresh token for google calendar application. Using this, the Google Calendar component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.

camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.con.name: camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.consumeFromNow
camel.kamelet.google-calendar-source.con.description: Consume events in the selected calendar from now on
